predicate.note: Frames file for 'compel' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. Comparison with 'force'.

example.name: all arguments
example.text: He recently voted `` present '' when the committee authorized a subpoena [0] [*T*-2] to compel Mr. Keating to testify [*T*-1] , then changed his vote to yes .

example.name: passive
example.text: That is , he is being compelled [*-2] to put them on the market too soon , and has already gotten offers that [*T*-1] are less than he paid [*?*] for some of the art works .

example.name: passive with adverbials
example.text: Thus , in a criminal case , a prosecutor can not comment on a defendant 's failure [*] to testify nor can the defendant be compelled [*-1] to take the stand as a witness , thus [*] forcing him to `` take the Fifth . ''
